meanings.definition: The act of receiving or accepting something willingly or eagerly.
meanings.sent1: She showed great kabbalas when offered help with her homework.
meanings.sent2: The kabbalas of the new policy were met with enthusiasm by the team.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's kabbalas for treats was unmatched, wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: His kabbalas for adventure led him to explore unknown lands.
meanings.sent5: The kabbalas of the crowd towards the performer was palpable, filling the room with energy.

meanings.definition: A set of mystical teachings and practices in Jewish tradition.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scrolls contained the secrets of kabbalas passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: Studying the kabbalas deepened her spiritual connection to her faith.
meanings.sent3: The magician's kabbalas book was full of spells and enchantments.
meanings.sent4: She felt as if she had unlocked the kabbalas of the universe after years of study.
meanings.sent5: The kabbalas of the rabbi were revered by all who sought wisdom and guidance.
